title: sweeteye
author: sweeteye
content: Hey all,Would love your opinion on this.I'm spending an increasing amount of time in the counterparty/XCP (bitcoin blockchain) collectible space and while there are channels and web marketplaces for artist's to sell their physical work, I think that this may also be a place given some of our past sales history and our collective community proclivity. Several of the XCP artists I'm in touch with may be interested in listing their physical work here - an original painting, drawing or rendering of their NFT, or of other artists work that they've been gifted, bought or traded for - all XCP/BTC project based, and in my estimation, all collectible.As my first love (and collection) is art, I'm compelled to support some of these artists here if there's a market and interest from our community.Would love opinions and am open to suggestions as well.Thanks.sweeteye

comments.author: sweeteye
comments.body: Quote from: PreciousMetapsICT on August 26, 2022, 12:59:46 AMÂ physical XCP piece? 100%A great example of the physical with the accompanyying NFT, Â a collab between Vlad and Rare Scrilla, here: https://xchain.io/asset/FAKEBTCTKVR on the bitcoin blockchain. If you bought the mag from scarce.city or Vlad you own the NFT of the cover art. It doesn't have to live anywhere but in your cold storage wallet at a legacy or segwit address.It can be viewed in a number of wallets without entering your private key.I personally trust the bitcoin blockchain with my money and now my art and collectibles.I can't say that any other blockchain I am aware of that NFT art is being produced on offers the same security.There's 118 pages of paper that could be damaged or stolen, but the NFT lives immutably on the blockchain.

comments.body: Quote from: Spokanistan51 on August 26, 2022, 12:12:59 AMAgree on the physical front. Digital NFT collectors will not only flood the forum, but the amount of theft/scams/negative activity will increase also. Glad to hear that and I hope the consensus here would remain that physical art with digital assets (NFTs) is a good thing.I disagree with you from my experience with XCP on the bitcoin blockchain.In fact, more scams have been perpetrated on the forum in the collectibles group during the time I've been involved with groups on XCP. Like here, there's a solid community of people looking out for each other and newbies, warning of fraud or bad actors.And in terms of the physical collector like myself looking to also have digital assets, or the digital collector learning about physicals, you're right the forum will be flooded with hungry, passionate collectors on the BTC blockchain.
